p: Medicinal sage ( S. officinalis) is one of the 900 species that have been found to be widely used in herbal medicine [ 29]. One of the reasons why other sage species have not yet been recognized as medicinal plants is accurate diagnosis and selection of the mode of their active functions. Systematic chemical analysis of different species of sage, including new variety Bona, and comparing it with the composition of medical sage can help find new further treatments.
